recipe_name: Quail skewers with sweet-and-sour coriander carrots
author: James Tanner
method: Soak two wooden skewers in cold water for 10-15 minutes. Drain.  For the quail, thread the breasts onto the two skewers and season well with salt and freshly ground black pepper.  Melt the butter in a frying pan and fry the quail for 4-5 minutes on both sides, or until cooked through and golden-brown.  For the carrots, place all of the carrot ingredients into a pan, add a splash of water and cook, covered, for 8-10 minutes or until tender.  To serve, spoon the carrots onto a serving plate and top with the quail skewers.
ingredients: 2 quail breasts,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  25g/1oz butter,  Â½ tsp coriander seeds, crushed in a pestle and mortar,  1 bunch baby carrots, trimmed and chopped,  2 tbsp red wine vinegar,  1 tbsp sugar
